programme.title: Jeanette gets to hold Cathy Freeman spikes from Sydney 2000 | The Vault
programme.desc: As they continue travelling in time in ‘The Vault’, Jeanette is taken to the Running Shoes Collection. She discovers the oldest spikes from the 19th century and is handed over Cathy Freeman’s shoes from Sydney 2000, when she won Gold in the 400 meters. Patricia, the Collections Manager, explains her how special the colours of those shoes are. Then we get to hear from Cathy herself how special was that night in Sydney for her whole nation.

programme.title: The Moschino dress from Torino 2006 regains its full splendour | The Vault
programme.desc: Fashion and design have always played a key role in the Olympic History. In Torino 2006, Moschino studio designed a piece of art for Miss Italia to wear in the Opening Ceremony. Jeanette connects with former Head Designer JoAnn Tan to get the full story behind the dress. Angelo is finishing the restoration just in time to put the dress back on display and lit it again for the first time in 15 years, in front of Jeanette.

programme.title: ‘Robin Hood’ caught on camera for the first at Tokyo 2020 | The Vault
programme.desc: Archer specialists say one chance in few thousands but on camera it is the first time ever a ‘Robin Hood’ shot is recorded live! Now on public display, Greg discovers this rare artefact with Stephanie, one of the Museum curators. Shot by the Korean pair, An San and Kim Je-deok in the mixed event, they won Gold in that first-ever event at the Olympics. An san went on winning three Gold medals in Tokyo, demonstrating the dominance of South Korea in this discipline.

programme.title: Forging India’s Badminton Champions | The Academy
programme.desc: We head to the hustle of Hyderabad to meet India’s badminton legend Pullela Gopichand and hear of his champion-building dream. Insights from legends such as Saina Nehwal, Sai Praneeth and Kidambi Srikanth.

programme.title: Youth take Centre Stage | The Academy
programme.desc: We head behind the scenes and hang out with of some of India’s rising badminton talent.

programme.title: The People’s Fighters | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The powerful story of how a revolutionary boxing experiment produced Teofilo Stevenson and a legacy of Cuban success at the Olympic Games.

programme.title: It’s Not All Work
programme.desc: The off-season allows a brief break from gymnastics for Angelina. Training intensifies for a fired-up Morgan, while Yile reaches breaking point.

programme.title: The Interruption
programme.desc: The COVID-19 pandemic rocks the gymnasts’ schedules. The Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games are heartbreakingly postponed. The three gymnasts remain determined to chase their Olympic dreams.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Sprinters
programme.desc: A journey through the essential stories of the Olympic Games, focusing on the sprints in athletics, including Jesse Owens and Carl Lewis.

programme.title: Michael: No rest on the road to Olympic gold | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Take a look inside Michael Norman’s rigid routine as he prepares to redeem himself with an Olympic gold in the 400m distance at Paris 2024 this summer. While he is visiting his first track and field community, with family and fiancee all behind him, the American sprinter is dedicated to excellence.

programme.title: Phil: breaking barriers to represent his community | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Canadian Breaker Phil ‘Wizard’ Kim, who comes from a traditional Korean family, takes to the streets of Vancouver, where he remembers how he fell in love with breaking and recounts his relentless journey to do what he loves the most : to dance.

programme.title: Ale: the Mexican diver trying to keep it all in synch | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Alejandra Orozco, two-time Olympic medallist in diving for Mexico, makes her fourth return to the Olympics at Paris 2024. More in sync than ever with her diving partner, Gabriela Agundez, and her family, she takes us back to where it all began: the family farm in the outskirt of Guadaljara. With the support of a loving family, hard work and dedication, she is hoping to reach the pinnacle of her career with Gold this Summer surrounded by her loved ones.

programme.title: Ni Nengah: a role model and a hero for Indonesia | The Starting Line
programme.desc: She is Indonesia’s premiere Paralympic powerlifter and the country’s pride. A two-time Paralympic medallist, she is a mentor for the team as she prepares for her next objective: taking gold at Paris 2024 this summer. Although a recent injury puts all her work at risk, she is confident she will rise to the challenge.

programme.title: The Vault, Treasures of the Olympics | Full Length
programme.desc: For the first time, Historian Greg Jenner and Olympian Jeanette Kwayke are given full access to go behind the scenes of the world’s greatest and most secure sporting collections to uncover the Treasures of the Olympics.

programme.title: B-Boys and B-Girls Take The Spotlight | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As breaking prepares to make its Olympics debut in Paris 2024, we go inside the lives and regimens of the top breakers in the world leading up to the games. We meet b-boy Victor and b-girl Nicka who have secured Olympic spots, along with Olympic hopeful b-girl Anti still battling her way to the top. They all meet up in Los Angeles for one of the top event of the scene.

programme.title: Olympic spirit : The story of the torch
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 3 : The Olympic spirit : The story of the torch.

programme.title: B-Boys and B-Girls Take The Spotlight | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As breaking prepares to make its Olympics debut in Paris 2024, we go inside the lives and regimens of the top breakers in the world leading up to the games. We meet b-boy Victor and b-girl Nicka who have secured Olympic spots, along with Olympic hopeful b-girl Anti still battling her way to the top. They all meet up in Los Angeles for one of the top event of the scene.

programme.title: Nicka takes it to the next level | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As b-girl Nicka continues her intense preparation for the Games, Anti is about to take on a new opponent at the WDSF Breaking for Gold Series in Hong Kong: Japanese b-girl Ayane, whose brother b-boy Shigekix has already confirmed his spot on Team Japan. The energy in Hong Kong is intense as Ayane tries to make a final push to reach the Olympic Qualifiying Series.

programme.title: Ayane and Shigekix, a breaking family | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Meet London-based b-girl Stefani who dances for Ukraine. Even though Ukraine’s breaking team is scattered across the globe, it doesn't dampen her spirit — she's all about having fun. Stefani faces b-girl Ayane at Hong Kong. Back in Japan, brother and sister breaking duo Shigekix and Ayane started breaking together. Along the last two years of competition, Shigekix is emerging as a favourite for a medal.

programme.title: Who will join B-boy Victor for Team USA | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Victor has secured a spot on Team USA. Who else will make it to Paris 2024? Jeffro is training with b-girl Logistix in Colorado Springs for a pre-Olympic festival in Japan. Each of our world class breakers gears up for the Olympic Qualifier Series and then the ultimate challenge: Olympic Games Paris 2024.

programme.title: Becoming an Olympic Legend | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after his famous tally of seven Olympic gold medals and seven world records, legendary swimmer Mark Spitz makes an emotional return to Munich Olympic Park and the swimming pool, where his life was changed forever.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Joy of Riding
programme.desc: The world’s best snowboarders reveal their addiction to going high: the unique sensory feeling of ‘getting air’ jumping out of a halfpipe.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Dangers
programme.desc: Is halfpipe riding the most dangerous Olympic sport? Athletes reveal the dangers and fears they must overcome to succeed.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Science
programme.desc: Athletes, sports scientists, halfpipe builders and snowboard makers reveal the factors that determine how high a rider can air.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | Ayumu Hirano Returns
programme.desc: After chasing his Olympic skateboarding dream, Japan’s two-time Olympic silver medallist Ayumu Hirano is back on his snowboard in search of gold.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | Highest Ski Air
programme.desc: Canadian Skier Dylan Marineau attempts to break the world record for the highest ski air in a halfpipe.

programme.title: Halfpipe Hype | The Evolution
programme.desc: Featuring epic snowboard airs, the world’s best snowboarders revisit the greatest moments in the history of getting air.

programme.title: France's Sevens captain targets gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Backed by a great team and high perfornming coaches, Carla's quest for Olympic gold symbolizes the rise of women's rugby since Rio 2016. From competing with boys to leading her nation to Silver in Tokyo 2020, the French rugby Seven squad’s captain inspires resilience and dedication on the road to Paris 2024.

programme.title: Niklas Kaul - medal contender for Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Despite an incredible 2019 season, winning gold at the World Championships and setting a world’s best record, decathlete Niklas Kaul from Germany faced challenges at Tokyo 2020 due to an injury sustained in the high jump event. After focusing on recovery and preparing for future competitions, he reached an impressive 4th place at the European Championships in Roma, which puts him back in a position to medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Leonardo Fabbri’s success is rooted in family support | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: From his early athletic beginnings to his emotional 22.34m throw, Leonardo's journey is marked by family support and a dream of Olympic success. Despite setbacks, his determination remains unshaken as he aims for glory at Paris 2024. The Tuscan shot putter won gold at the European Championships, setting a championship record and placing him as a serious contender for the coming games.

programme.title: Matteo Zurloni Italy’s world champion climbs to the top | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Dive into the remarkable journey of Matteo Zurloni, from small town dreamer to Olympic contender. He won the speed event at the 2023 IFSC Climbing World Championships and earning a shot at Olympic glory. Follow his ascent from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of international competition, where every climb is a test of skill, courage, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

programme.title: Norwegian duo are targeting back-to-back Olympic Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Reigning World and Olympic Champions Christian Sørum and Anders Mol are dominating beach volleyball. Their partnership, rooted in a Viking mentality, has kept them atop the sport for six years. They are now preparing for a historic back-to-back Olympic gold at Paris 2024 to honour Christian's mother's legacy.

programme.title: Doubles Trouble: Rohan Bopanna’s Olympic Journey
programme.desc: Join India’s top men’s doubles tennis player, Rohan Bopanna, as he seeks the perfect partner for Paris 2024. Relive his historic victories, heartbreaking defeats, and past Olympic adventures and witness his relentless pursuit of excellence at age 44. Will he bring India a long-awaited tennis medal?

programme.title: A Family Affair | The Academy
programme.desc: We head to Pullela Gopichand’s home as the family reflects on how far they have come. Pullela’s daughter Gayatri is put through her paces.

programme.title: The Rise of the Doubles Players | The Academy
programme.desc: India’s doubles players are thriving lately. We hang out with the charismatic men’s team of Satwick and Shetty, and follow Sikki Reddy through rehabilitation.

programme.title: The Future of Indian Badminton | The Academy
programme.desc: Pullela Gopichand looks towards the future with the latest batch of young students at the academy, some of whom rise at 3am to learn to play badminton.

programme.title: The Invisible Bond | Documentary
programme.desc: Discover the invisible bond that forges the relationship between an athlete with visual impairment and his guide. This bond transcends the field of play developed by trust, friendship, and the unwavering desire of achieving Paralympic glory.

programme.title: Running in North Korea | Film
programme.desc: A new Original documentary that captures the incredible journey of Aimee Fuller and Mirjam Jaeger as they travel to Pyongyang to participate in the 2019 Mangyongdae Prize International Marathon and meet fellow Olympians from the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea.

programme.title: How India’s top archer Deepika Kumari refused to give up
programme.desc: The incredible journey of India’s top archer from a childhood born in poverty to competing on the world’s highest stages. Though Rio ultimately ended in disappointment for Kumari, she’s not done yet.

programme.title: Meet the karateka champion teaching Indian girls self-defence
programme.desc: With karate set to make its Olympic debut in Tokyo, Sandhya Shetty is ready to show what she can do – all while inspiring young Indian girls to stand up for themselves.

programme.title: Sakshi Malik: The wrestling star defying stereotypes in India
programme.desc: With her Olympic bronze medal in Rio 2016, Malik paved the way for a younger generation of female Indian wrestlers to join the sport despite immense societal barriers. See what motivates her on the road to Tokyo 2020.

programme.title: India’s favourite gymnast Dipa Karmakar dreams of Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Millions of Indians cheered when Dipa Karmakar made it to the vault finals in Rio 2016 and finished fourth despite modest training facilities in her hometown. She’s now eyeing and even better finish in Tokyo 2020.

programme.title: Olympic spirit : The story of the torch
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 3 : The Olympic spirit : The story of the torch.

programme.title: B-Boys and B-Girls Take The Spotlight | Breaking Life, Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: As breaking prepares to make its Olympics debut in Paris 2024, we go inside the lives and regimens of the top breakers in the world leading up to the games. We meet b-boy Victor and b-girl Nicka who have secured Olympic spots, along with Olympic hopeful b-girl Anti still battling her way to the top. They all meet up in Los Angeles for one of the top event of the scene.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Marathon
programme.desc: The best moments from the Olympic Games’ ultimate endurance events with stories from Emil Zatopek and Frank Shorter.

programme.title: A Family Affair | The Academy
programme.desc: We head to Pullela Gopichand’s home as the family reflects on how far they have come. Pullela’s daughter Gayatri is put through her paces.

Each of our world class breakers gears up for the Olympic Qualifier Series and then the ultimate challenge: Olympic Games Paris 2024.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | John John Florence
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer John John Florence in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore his journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Tatiana Weston-Webb
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Tatiana Weston-Webb in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore her journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Leonardo Fioravanti
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Leonardo Fioravanti in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore his journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Lucca Mesinas
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Lucca Mesinas in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore his journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Teresa Bonvalot
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Teresa Bonvalot in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore her journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Shino Matsuda
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Shino Matsuda in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore her journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Jordy Smith
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Jordy Smith in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore his journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Griffin Colapinto
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Griffin Colapinto in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore his journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Rio Waida
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Rio Waida in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore his journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: See You in Teahupo'o | Brisa Hennessy﻿
programme.desc: Dive into Olympic dreams with surfer Brisa Hennessy﻿ in “See You in Teahupo'o”. Explore her journey, Olympic experiences, and reflections on the legendary Teahupo'o wave.

programme.title: France’s Didier Dinart (extended)
programme.desc: Follow the two-time Olympic gold medallist handball player as he returns to his home island of Guadeloupe to see his lasting legacy.

programme.title: Germany’s Matthias Steiner (extended)
programme.desc: Watch the extended version of the Legends Live On episode featuring German weightlifter Matthias Steiner, who won an inspiring gold medal at the Beijing 2008 Olympic Games shortly after the unexpected death of his wife. As a major figure and best-selling author in Germany, he is now inspiring future generations to lead healthier lives.

programme.title: France’s Edgar Grospiron (extended)
programme.desc: French moguls skier Edgar Grospiron won gold in Albertville 1992. He is now supporting the next generation of Olympic champions.

programme.title: Russia's Svetlana Khorkina (extended)
programme.desc: Most successful Russian gymnast of all time Svetlana Khorkina is now a driving force behind CSKA, the army sports club of Moscow. Watch documentary Legends Live On.

programme.title: Italy’s Valentina Vezzali (extended)
programme.desc: Watch the extended version of Legends Live On featuring six-time gold medallist Valentina Vezzali whose domination in fencing earned her the nickname "Cobra."

programme.title: Olympic spirit : The story of the torch
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 3 : The Olympic spirit : The story of the torch.

programme.title: The Vault, Treasures of the Olympics | Full Length
programme.desc: For the first time, Historian Greg Jenner and Olympian Jeanette Kwayke are given full access to go behind the scenes of the world’s greatest and most secure sporting collections to uncover the Treasures of the Olympics.

programme.title: The Olympic Series: The Olympic spirit : Redefining sport
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 4 : The Olympic spirit : Redefining sport.

programme.title: Teahupo'o Surf Camp | Road to Paris 2024
programme.desc: Experience the thrills and spills as seven surfers join an ISA surf camp at Teahupo'o, Tahiti's famed surf spot and the surfing venue for the Olympic Games Paris 2024. Determined to conquer the Olympic wave, they face their fears, push the boundaries and challenge the raw power of nature.

programme.title: Ezra: A high-jumper finds community and another chance | The Starting Line
programme.desc: As high-jump reigning World Champion, Ezra Frech prepares to return to the Paralympics for the second time. He reflects on his remarkable journey with his father and together with his mother, he takes us to meet their wider and beloved Californian community as they organize a unique event for adaptative sports in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Carlota: Proving herself and her sport to the world | The Starting Line
programme.desc: A young female breaker for France, Carlota Dudek is training to qualify for the Olympics to showcase her unique style to the world, inherited from her mother Cuban origin. We travel with her from Paris to her hometown in the heart of Provence where her life-long dance journey began.

programme.title: Manon: How the bond with her horse changed her life | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Two-time medallist in dressage at Tokyo 2020, Manon Claeys shares her inspiring journey back from severe injury to Paralympic podium. After her accident, she thought she would never ride a horse again. Now, together with her cherished horse Katarina, and surrounded by her team and family, she trains to achieve a gold medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Triumph and Tragedy | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: In an emotional journey with his son and grandson, Finland’s Lasse Virén revisits the spot where he rose to his feet after a dramatic fall to win gold. The next day, the spirit of Munich was shattered when a terror attack at the Olympic Village took the lives of 11 Israeli athletes and coaches – a day of tragedy as told by an Israeli survivor, Shaul Ladany, and the gold medallists from around the world who bore witness.

programme.title: Ginter is the defensive rock for Germany at World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: He was the youngest player in the Germany squad which went on to win the World Cup in 2014. Silver medallist at Rio 2016 Olympic Games, he played for Borussia Dortmund and Borussia Mönchengladbach before moving back to his hometown club of SC Freiburg. But behind a very friendly and family man, he is the defensive rock to take Germany to a new glory in Qatar.

programme.title: David Raum is the new Mannschaft’s shooting star | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Written off and sent to play in the second Bundesliga in Germany, Raum helped to propel his club to first division. After joining the national team at Tokyo 2020, he made a meteoric rise to RB Leipzig. He is now part of the senior national team and ready to shatter his opponents’ defense at the 2022 World Cup.

programme.title: Kouyaté's fearless road to World Cup is a life lesson | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Cheikhou Kouyaté left Senegal as a teenager to begin his football journey at F.C. Brussels. London 2012 was instrumental to his integration in the national team, followed by solid moves to West Ham United and Crystal Palace. His last years success at African Cup of Nations propelled him to the next level at Nottingham Forest. He is now gearing up with the Lions for the World Cup hoping to make history.

programme.title: Spain’s number one keeper ready to shine at World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Establishing yourself as the number one keeper for Spain is no easy feat but thats what Unai Simón has been doing for two years now. As he recovered from his mistake at UEFA Euro 2020, he went on to win a silver medal at Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games. He is now aiming to earn a new title with the Spanish team at the World Cup 2022 in Qatar.

programme.title: Bednarek leads a new generation of players for Poland | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Jan Bednarek is a strong and skillful centre back who now plays for Aston Villa. He was raised in a family obsessed with football, including his brother Filip, who plays professionally as a goalkeeper in their home country. Poland’s last success in an international tournament was winning Silver at the Barcelona 1992 Olympic Games but a new generation of players is ready to take the 2022 World Cup by storm.

programme.title: Elaine Thompson-Herah: One sprint to rule them all | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How Elaine Thompson-Herah became the undisputed sprinting queen and the first woman to win the 100-200m double gold at consecutive Olympics.

programme.title: Neeraj Chopra: Throws his way into a nation's heart | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Neeraj Chopra makes Olympic history with the first-ever Olympic gold medal in track-and-field for India.

programme.title: Ariarne Titmus: Splashing into swimming royalty | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How Ariarne Titmus went from chasing gold to being the one to beat after nail bitter 200m and 400m freestyle victories in Tokyo2020

programme.title: Carissa Moore: Carrying surfers' aloha spirit to the top of the podium | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How native Hawaiian Carissa Moore, honoured generations of surfers by winning the sport's first Olympic gold medal.

programme.title: United States’ Natalie Coughlin I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of twelve-time medallist, Natalie Coughlin, and what she is doing now.

programme.title: Japan’s Nomura Tadahiro I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of Japan’s three-time gold medallist Nomura Tadahiro, and what he is doing now.

programme.title: Nuffin for Nuffin | Documentary
programme.desc: Forty-five years after their first and only Olympic medal, Bermuda's hopes of glory now rest on the shoulders of a new generation of boxers. See how these young boxers overcome adversity and struggle beyond the ropes to keep this tiny island nation's Olympic dreams alive.

programme.title: Manuel: the next big thing in Angola’s favorite sport | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young basketball player from Angola shows us what the sport means to him and dreams of the endelless posibilities the future holds.

programme.title: Miyanda: the lioness of Southafica’s BMX scene | Playing Fields
programme.desc: Miyanda Masseti is the highest ranked female BMX rider in Africa, shows us what inspires her to keep pushing and opening new possibilities for future female BMX riders in Africa.

programme.title: Ornella: knocking down social prejudices pursuing her Olympic dream | Playing Fields
programme.desc: As the first female boxer to represent her country, Ornella shows us why it’s important for the world to see more female African boxers on the global stage.

programme.title: Gold Medals Relived | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: US athletic comeback star Dave Wottle, Germany’s celebrated gymnast Karin Janz, acclaimed sprinter Valeriy Borzov, and nine-time Olympic medallist Ludmilla Tourischeva revisit their gold medal journeys during Munich 1972.

programme.title: Basketball vs Cricket with Akanksha Singh and Jemimah Rodrigues | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: Can cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues score a free throw shot? What happens when a basketball player attempts to bat in cricket?

programme.title: Archery vs Cricket with Pravin Jadhav and Yuzvendra Chahal | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: How hard is it for a cricketer to pull the bow string? What are the skills that an Olympic archer can transfer to his cricket game?

programme.title: Badminton vs Cricket with Srikanth Kidambi and Yuzvendra Chahal | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: Can cricketers play badminton? And what happens when India’s badminton champion Srikanth Kidambi swaps his racket for a cricket bat?

programme.title: The graceful journey of Olympic champion, Jessica von Bredow-Werndl | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Jessica’s dream became reality at Tokyo 2020 with two Olympic Gold medals in dressage in the individual and team event. But her incredible bond with her horse, Dalera, is forged by hard work and an implacable discipline at Aubenhausen world-class riding centre. With her title back on the line at Paris 2024, she opens the doors of her family estate and reflects, with her family and her team, on an emotional journey full of joy and determination.

programme.title: French kiteboarding prodigee on her way to gold at Paris | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Lauriane Nolot, the current world champion, aims for Gold at Paris 2024 on the shores of Marseille where Formula Kite will make its Olympic debut. Hailing from Camps-la-Source, an hour away from the Olympic venue, she climbs the ranks with determination from family get-aways to world podium. Her impressive journey propels her to the pinnacle of her sport, ready to shine on the Olympic stage.

programme.title: Iris Tió is key to Spain’s next gold in Artistic Swimming | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Iris Tió Casas joined the senior national team at 15, living away from her parents most of the time. Four years later she competed in Tokyo where she was the youngest on the team. For Paris 2024, she will be crucial to the team’s chances, aiming for gold at Paris 2024. Her journey reflects immense dedication, resilience, and a dream realized through hard work. She will compete in the team as well as in the duet event with her partner Alissa Ozhogina.

programme.title: Helen Glover eyes Paris 2024 for her fourth Olympics | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: After winning back-to-back gold in London 2012 and Rio 2016, Helen Glover made a remarkable come-back in Tokyo 2020, being the first mother to row for Britain. She and partner Polly Swann finished fourth. Helen now has her sights on Paris 2024 where she should be competing in the Women's four event, focusing on adding another Olympic medal to her impressive career for Team GB.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Aquatics
programme.desc: The best diving, swimming and water polo stories from throughout Olympic history including Dawn Fraser, Greg Louganis and Michael Phelps.

programme.title: Greg discovers some of the rarest photos of Chamonix 1924 | The Vault
programme.desc: Greg and Photography curator Audrey unveil the story of Sonja Henie, a Norwegian Figure skater, and the youngest athlete to participate to the first Olympic Winter Games in Chamonix in 1924. She was 11. Her performance together with other events been immortalized by Auguste Couttet. He was a local photographer using glass plate photography at the time. Sonja later became a film star in Hollywood.

programme.title: Jeanette gets to hold Cathy Freeman spikes from Sydney 2000 | The Vault
programme.desc: As they continue travelling in time in ‘The Vault’, Jeanette is taken to the Running Shoes Collection. She discovers the oldest spikes from the 19th century and is handed over Cathy Freeman’s shoes from Sydney 2000, when she won Gold in the 400 meters. Patricia, the Collections Manager, explains her how special the colours of those shoes are. Then we get to hear from Cathy herself how special was that night in Sydney for her whole nation.

programme.title: The Moschino dress from Torino 2006 regains its full splendour | The Vault
programme.desc: Fashion and design have always played a key role in the Olympic History. In Torino 2006, Moschino studio designed a piece of art for Miss Italia to wear in the Opening Ceremony. Jeanette connects with former Head Designer JoAnn Tan to get the full story behind the dress. Angelo is finishing the restoration just in time to put the dress back on display and lit it again for the first time in 15 years, in front of Jeanette.

programme.title: ‘Robin Hood’ caught on camera for the first at Tokyo 2020 | The Vault
programme.desc: Archer specialists say one chance in few thousands but on camera it is the first time ever a ‘Robin Hood’ shot is recorded live! Now on public display, Greg discovers this rare artefact with Stephanie, one of the Museum curators. Shot by the Korean pair, An San and Kim Je-deok in the mixed event, they won Gold in that first-ever event at the Olympics. An san went on winning three Gold medals in Tokyo, demonstrating the dominance of South Korea in this discipline.

programme.title: Forging India’s Badminton Champions | The Academy
programme.desc: We head to the hustle of Hyderabad to meet India’s badminton legend Pullela Gopichand and hear of his champion-building dream. Insights from legends such as Saina Nehwal, Sai Praneeth and Kidambi Srikanth.

programme.title: Youth take Centre Stage | The Academy
programme.desc: We head behind the scenes and hang out with of some of India’s rising badminton talent.

programme.title: The People’s Fighters | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The powerful story of how a revolutionary boxing experiment produced Teofilo Stevenson and a legacy of Cuban success at the Olympic Games.

programme.title: The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.3, Program 1 : The Olympic spirit : Greek gift, the ancient games.

programme.title: Khalifa: An Olympic dream in the heart of Africa’s football powerhouse | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young Ghanian football player takes us into his world. Through his community, family and team we learn why football is so important to him and what he hopes to accomplish one day.

programme.title: Aya: the first female swimmer to represent Gabon at the Olympics | Playing Fields
programme.desc: An Olympic swimmer overcomes her tragic past and is determined to keep swimming. We see the inspiring relationship she has with her father as they train for future competitions.

programme.title: Ayomide: Born in a canoe, now a Nigerian rowing star | Playing Fields
programme.desc: Her mother gave birth to her inside a canoe some 20 years ago. Ayomide Bello grew up to become the first female canoeist from Nigeria to qualify for the Olympics.

programme.title: Memory Lane | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after their Olympic victories in Munich, famed gymnast Olga Korbut, Germany’s long jump star Heide Rosendahl, Kenya’s long-distance running hero Kip Keino and Great Britain’s celebrated pentathlete Mary Peters make an emotional return to the scene of their gold medal wins.

programme.title: Boxing vs Cricket with Vikas Krishan Yadav and Harbhajan Singh | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: Can a boxer bat? And does a bowler have the power and precision to throw a punch? India’s cricket legend Harbhajan Singh swaps sports for one day with boxing champion Vikas Krishan Yadav.

programme.title: Table Tennis vs Cricket with Sharath Kamal and Harbhajan Singh | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: Can bowler Harbhajan Singh make use of his spinning skills in table tennis? What happens when a table tennis champion becomes a cricket bowler?

programme.title: Shooting vs Cricket with Manu Bhaker and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: What happens in the battle of precision between cricket and shooting? The challenge is on, as Smriti Mandhana and Manu Bhaker swap the pistols and bats.

programme.title: Hockey vs Cricket with Savita Punia and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: India’s national hockey team goalkeeper Savita Punia swaps her hockey stick for a cricket bat. Can her skills in hockey help her become a better cricketer?

programme.title: Enzo Lefort's quest for individual gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Explore Enzo Lefort's journey from his Guadeloupean roots to the Paris 2024 Olympics, driven by his ambition for individual gold. Witness his rigorous training regimen and unwavering determination, fueled by past victories at World Championships and Olympic Games in the team events. As the Games draw near, Lefort's focus intensifies as he prepares to compete on home turf, aiming to etch his name in Olympic history with a triumphant performance in a memorable venue: le Grand Palais at the heart of Paris.

programme.title: B-Girl India aims for historic gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Follow India's remarkable journey from hometown studio of La Hague to the Olympic stage. While she qualified for the Games at the European Championships, with her unique style blending raw energy and finesse, she faces formidable rivals on her quest for breaking glory. Will her unmatched determination and skill make history at the Olympics where the sport is making its debut at Paris 2024?

programme.title: Kauli Vaast’s Tahitian roots make him a favourite for Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Witness Kauli Vaast's journey from his childhood Tahitian shores to the world stage. Surrounded by his family and long time friend and mentor Jeremy Flores, he refines his craft at Teahupo'o impressive pipe where he will compete on hometurf for an Olympic Gold medal in surfing. Driven by passion and cheered on by those who believe in his dream, he balances the thrill of competition with the warmth of a unique community.

programme.title: Kieran Reilly’s ride to the world stage | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Join Kieran Reilly on his quest for Olympic glory as he reflects on his journey from Gateshead to becoming BMX world champion. He navigates the challenges of training, family support, and personal growth, while striving to make his hometown proud. Follow his inspirational story as he prepares to represent his community at the next Olympic Games in Paris 2024.

programme.title: Teresa Portela Olympic longevity makes her a legend | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Marked by determination, Teresa Portela's journey unfolds over six Olympics. From Rio to Tokyo, Portela's pursuit of Olympic glory was balanced between being an elite athlete and the joys of motherhood. In Tokyo, she finally won a long-awaited medal by bringing home silver in the K-1 200 canoe sprint event. Now training for Paris 2024, she will become the first Spanish woman to compete in seven Olympic Games.

programme.title: Road to Glory - Athletics - The Middle Distance
programme.desc: The stories behind the key moments in middle distance running at the Olympic Games, including stars like Paavo Nurmi and Maria Mutola.
